name: AWS EC2
description: This app integrates with AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to perform virtualization actions

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration

filters.description: One or more filters, separated by commas. Example: { 'Name': 'name1', 'Values': [ 'value1' ] }, { 'Name': 'name2', 'Values': [ 'value2' ] }

instance_ids.description: One or more instance IDs, separated by commas

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return in a single call

next_token.description: Token to request the next page of results

actions.description: Detach an instance from an autoscaling group

instance_ids.description: Up to 20 IDs of the instances, separated by commas

autoscaling_group_name.description: The name of the autoscaling group

should_decrement_desired_capacity.description: Decrement the desired capacity value by the number of instances being detached

example_values: At 2019-04-11T10:15:55Z instance i-0fc20335d5bd6a222 was detached in response to a user request, shrinking the capacity from 7 to 6

actions.description: Attach an instance to an autoscaling group

instance_ids.description: Up to 20 IDs of the instances, separated by commas

autoscaling_group_name.description: The name of the autoscaling group

actions.description: Deregister an instance from AWS Elastic Load Balance

load_balancer_name.description: Name of the classic load balancer
load_balancer_name.verbose: The load balancer provided in the input has to be in the active state and type classic

instance_ids.description: One or more instance IDs, separated by commas

actions.description: Snapshot AWS instance that has the given IP address or instance ID

volume_id.description: The ID of the Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume

tag_specifications.description: The tags to apply to the snapshot during creation, separated by commas. Example: { 'Name': 'name1', 'Values': [ 'value1' ] }, { 'Name': 'name2', 'Values': [ 'value2' ] }

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

tag_value.description: Tag value. Defaults to an empty string if left blank

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

actions.description: Remove specified tag from an instance
actions.verbose: If user specifies a tag key without a tag value, it deletes any tag with this key regardless of its value. If user specifies a tag key with an empty string as the tag value, it deletes the tag only if its value is an empty string. If user omits this parameter, it deletes all user-defined tags for the specified resources. It does not delete AWS-generated tags (tags that have the aws: prefix)

tag_value.description: Tag value. If not specified, all tags with tag_key will be removed. If empty string "" is specified, then tag_key with value of empty string will be removed

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

actions.description: Get one or more network ACLs

filters.description: One or more filters in dictionary format, separated by commas. Example: { 'Name': 'string', 'Values': [ 'string' ]}

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

network_acl_ids.description: One or more network ACL IDs, separated by commas

vpc_id.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC)

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

actions.description: Remove ACL from an instance. The default network ACL and ACLs associated with any subnets cannot be deleted

network_acl_id.description: The ID of the network ACL

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

filters.description: One or more filters in dictionary format, separated by commas. Example: { 'Name': 'string', 'Values': [ 'string' ]}

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

group_ids.description: One or more security group IDs, separated by commas. Required for security groups in a non-default VPC

group_names.description: One or more security group names, separated by commas

next_token.description: The token to request the next page of results

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return in a single call

actions.description: Assign an instance to a security group

group_to_add.description: The security group ID to add

example_values: Successfully added instance to security group
Status: Successfully added instance to security group

actions.description: Removes an EC2 instance from a security group

group_to_remove.description: The security group ID to remove

example_values: Successfully removed instance from security group
Status: Successfully removed instance from security group

actions.description: Create a VPC with the specified IPv4 CIDR block

cidr_block.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. For example: 10.0.0.0/16

amazon_provided_ipv6_cidr_block.description: The Amazon provided IPv6 CIDR block with a /56 prefix length

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

instance_tenancy.description: The tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC

example_values: Instance tenancy: default, Vpc id: vpc-0840e9850b3f02915

filters.description: One or more filters in dictionary format, separated by commas. Example: { 'Name': 'string', 'Values': [ 'string' ]}

dry_run.description: Check if asset has required permissions for the action

network_interface_ids.description: One or more network interface IDs, separated by commas

next_token.description: The token to request the next page of results

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return in a single call

autoscaling_group_names.description: The names of the Auto Scaling groups, separated by commas

next_token.description: The token for the next set of items to return

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return in a single call
